page.title: 09Porter's Mill
page.content: Originally named Tapenhall and built in AD 957, it was the porperty of the Priory of Worcester. It stands on the River Salwarpe and the disused Droitwich Canal runs nearby. The Porter family owned it from AD 1290 until 1709. It was rebuilt in 1861 and was converted into a dwelling house in 1983. The old mill wheel and pulley equipment remain intact. In converting the Mill, it has been extended to twice its pre - 1983 size. The exterior retains the plain brickwork and small lead paned windows. The interior is wood panelled throughout and it comfortably furnished in an open plan style . The present owners, Dr. Higginson and family plan to restore the old mill equipment.
